posts.name: Anand Ballabh
posts.cooked:
Hello sir,
I am getting data for only first 1000 users (It is saying github has limit of 1000)
How to solve this problem

posts.name: Vishwas saini
posts.cooked: hi i am also facing problem’s while using the github api

posts.name: Jivraj Singh Shekhawat
posts.cooked:
You can use personal access token, that allows you to send 5000 requests in 1 hour.

For dataset you mentioned Barcelona:100 there are only 337 users.

posts.name: Jivraj Singh Shekhawat
posts.cooked: can you express what problems you are facing with github api’s?

posts.name: Anand Ballabh
posts.cooked:
I am using this API

https://api.github.com/search/users?q=location:barcelona

is it correct. Its showing “total_count”: 30569"

When I am fetching page by page its giving result for only 1000. However I am using API token generated from GITHUB

posts.name: Bhavin
posts.cooked:
Add the followers constraint and the results should limit to what the TA mentioned.

Also authenticated users will have relaxed rate limit to query the data. Refer below to see how can you generate a token for yourself,

Generate access token

posts.cooked:
Follow this to generate Personal access token

GitHub Docs

Managing your personal access tokens - GitHub Docs

You can use a personal access token in place of a password when authenticating to GitHub in the command line or with the API.

posts.name: Senthil Kumar D
posts.cooked: I am using personal access token classic for accessing the API https://api.github.com/users/{userlogin} to get the user details. But I am not able to trigger 337 requests. I tried changing the network, using access token from different github account, requesting from google collab, requesting from jupyter notebook in local machine. Still I am getting "“API rate limit exceeded for {ipaddress}” error then “You have triggered an abuse detection mechanism. Please wait a few minutes before you try again.”. I am getting this error both yesterday and today.

posts.name: Sid
posts.cooked:
Hi. Personal tokens(authenticated) have a rate limit of 5000/hr requests.
Are you sure the token is getting set appropriately? Try validating the code using any LLM tool. May be recreate a new token, selecting default values

link_counts.title: Rate limits for the REST API - GitHub Docs
Authenticating to the REST API - GitHub Docs

posts.name: Senthil Kumar D
posts.cooked:
user_url='https://api.github.com/users/'
user_headers = {'Authorization':'Bearer MY_TOKEN', 'Accept': 'application/vnd.github+json', 'X-GitHub-Api-Version': '2022-11-28'}
df = pd.DataFrame()
time_list=[1,2,3,4]
for user_login in user_login_list:
  time.sleep(random.choice(time_list))
  print(user_login)
  user_full_url = user_url + user_login
  user_detail_resp = requests.get(user_full_url, user_headers);
  user_detail = user_detail_resp.json()
  print(user_detail)
  df_temp = pd.json_normalize(user_detail)
  df = pd.concat([df, df_temp])
print(df.columns)

This is code I am using. I generated the token again. Still I am not able to make more than 60 requests per hour. Am I making any syntax mistake in authenticating the request ? I am not able to find out.

posts.name: Bhavin
posts.cooked:
I think you are missing the formatting marker ‘f’ and the variable placeholder {MY_TOKEN} in user_headers also I don’t recall the Authorization header had ‘Bearer’ or ‘token’ prefix. You can try these first.
For further debugging, you can run below code to find out if you are really consuming your quota from authenticated limits or not.

GITHUB_TOKEN = '<<GITHUB TOKEN>>'

def check_rate_limit():
    url = 'https://api.github.com/rate_limit'
    headers = {'Authorization': f'token {GITHUB_TOKEN}'}

    response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

    if response.status_code == 200:
        rate_limit_info = response.json()
        core_limit = rate_limit_info['resources']['core']
        search_limit = rate_limit_info['resources']['search']

        print("Core Rate Limit:")
        print(f"- Remaining: {core_limit['remaining']}")
        print(f"- Reset: {core_limit['reset']}")

        print("Search Rate Limit:")
        print(f"- Remaining: {search_limit['remaining']}")
        print(f"- Reset: {search_limit['reset']}")
    else:
        print(f"Failed to check rate limit: {response.status_code} - {response.text}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    check_rate_limit()
